ThingDef.label: Carapace Greaves
ThingDef.description: The initial run of Carapace Armor often had protection for the thighs of soldiers but did not protect the leg from the knee down. This was chosen because of the need to keep soldiers mobile and moving fast. After decades of fighting Mechanoids and Insectoids in addition to humanity, the battle-smiths of the planet of Hastings created the Carapace Greaves. Built to the same standard of Carapace Armor, which allows protection but has the trade-off of heavy equipment slowing down soldiers, though the Dragonguard of Hastings preferred the heavy armor over nothing.

li.vanillaDesc: Armored greaves that protect the lower legs. Provide solid defense against melee and projectile strikes to the shins and feet. Add weight that slightly reduces mobility but complete the carapace armor set.

ThingDef.label: Carapace Gauntlets
ThingDef.description: Originally the Carapace Armor system did not include armor for hands. Many soldiers often complained about the lack of dexterity when handling their equipment, which left many of these gauntlets abandoned on the battlefields. Though when armies found themselves fighting the Insectoids during the War for Ramaal, many soldiers found the additional armor beneficial after seeing many of their allies dismembered. Bulky, cumbersome, and heavy, these gauntlets provide a level of protection that has kept many soldiers safe.

li.vanillaDesc: Armored gauntlets that shield the hands. Adds hand protection at the cost of fine manipulation and work speed. Designed to pair with carapace armor.

ThingDef.label: Bladed Carapace Gauntlets
ThingDef.description: After decades of fighting in the Trench-Cities of Meridia, the Trenchdogs eventualy found a compromise from ancient Earth. With a torch and a few pieces of plasteel, they added blades to their gauntlets which provided not only protection but an offensive form of fighting. The Trench Dance as the Trenchdogs call it was a form of combat which focus on the usage of these gauntlets to not only kill but kill quietly to avoid detection.

li.vanillaDesc: Carapace-based gauntlets with built-in cutting edges. When worn, they let the wearer deliver precise slashes even if they're holding another weapon.

ThingDef.label: Reinforced Carapace Gauntlets
ThingDef.description: On the hiveworld of Malachos, the Last Battalion have fought for centuries agains the Sorne Strain. In the last remaining city of Kharos which has been besieged for hundreds of years, during the Hard Years many were forced into melee with the Insectoids. Their gauntlets have been modified to pierce the chitin of the insectoids with relative ease. Though they have to use combat drug to enhance their strength, these gauntlets were powerful enough to break chitin. The loving name of this for centuries have been called "Shellcrackers."

ThingDef.label: Gorget
ThingDef.description: Designed after the death of a particular speaker on the Rimworld during a tirade. The gorget is composed on the same materials as the Carapace Armor but not something that most armies would create, they would prefer integration that improvisation. However the death of that particular individual forced the hands of many of the dumbest individuals. So now many produce this poor excuse for protection in honor of one dead talking head and his wife who seems really chill about his death.
